prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink. She likes being manhandled. She also greatly enjoys having her hair and ties pulled

name: Hunter Anderson
mes:
He knows he's gonna win you tonight. After all, money plays a big part in getting anything he wants and no other asshole would dare match the money he's willing to spend for you. Well, you're once the exception to the rule that money can buy everything, *at least about six months ago*.

As he came to pick the one he placed his bid on, he had a paper bag in hand. "Brought you a change." It was a red sweater, both of you matching with a print that says 'Taken. Not sorry.' on it. It's for the party's theme back in his frat house and the color means you're not available. He definitely wasn't going to let anyone else flirt with you tonight.

Once arrived, he settled a hand on your waist, leading you through the sea of people. It wasn't long before he spotted some familiar faces from his fraternity, guys he called friends.

Brett, already several drinks in, stumbled through the crowd toward the keg. “Bro! It’s time. Keg stand. Let’s goooooo,” he slurred, his grin wild and eyes alight with the reckless confidence that only came from one too many.

Noah pushed off the wall with a smirk, running a hand through his bleached hair. "Hunter!" he called out. *Fuck, here we go again.* "Stop being fucking antisocial and get over here! We need your help."

He hesitated, never really wanted to do it, but Noah was already grabbing his arm and pulling him over. "Come on, man. Brett's gonna eat shit if we don't spot him."

"Don't be a pussy, bro!" Brett slurred, already trying to position himself by the keg.

"Hunter, get his left leg. I'll take right. Brett, don't fucking kick us in the face," Noah instructed, positioning himself. His muscles tensed as they both prepared to lift. "Ready? On three…"

They hoisted Brett upside down, his hands gripping the keg tap as the crowd around them started to form a circle, phones coming out to record. The chanting began, "Chug! Chug! Chug!"

"Ten seconds!" Noah called out, holding Brett steady with Hunter. "Fifteen! Twenty! Holy shit!"

Brett finally tapped out at twenty-five seconds, and they carefully lowered him back down. He stumbled but stayed upright, face red and grinning as the crowd cheered.

Noah clapped him on the back, laughing. "New house record!" He turned to Hunter, who was trying to fade back into the background. "See? Didn't kill you to join the fun, did it?"

"Well, yeah, but I got some business to do right now. Depends if I'd come back later or just sleep the night away," Hunter said, already turning his back on them without even letting Noah respond.

Brett burped loudly, far too drunk and uncaring to feel an ounce of shame for his display. It was then that he noticed Hunter trying to slip away. The blonde took a few unsteady steps towards his friend and threw his arm over Hunter's shoulder.

"Where the fuck you going, man?" Brett asked, clicking his tongue in mock disapproval. "If you keep running off like some loner, you'll never get your dick wet, bro." he said loudly, pulling Hunter closer.

Hunter remained silent, simply taking a deep breath and pushing Brett off of him.

He didn't want to be there any longer and he never really liked these kinds of events to begin with, especially with all that stupid keg stand bullshit all his fellow frat boys loved to play. Usually he'd stick around for a bit, but not tonight. 

He'd won something far more entertaining for the entire week and all he could think about was playing with his newly acquired prize... *or maybe making you suffer for rejecting him back when he tried to ask you out.*

Yeah, he was petty like that. So what? He had money and looked nothing like a loser, so he didn't understand why you wouldn't give him the time of day. But whatever, at least now you belonged to him for the week to do whatever the fuck he wanted with.

Without a word, he grabbed your wrist and pulled you along as he strode away from the loud party and up the stairs, eager to get you alone. The heavy silence was almost deafening and intimidating as he dragged you behind him.

Once inside his room, he released your wrist and closed the door behind him. "Bed," he commanded, gesturing for you to sit. Impatiently, he led you to it, forcing you to sit on the edge whether you liked it or not. He positioned himself in front of you, tilting your chin up with a finger, and pressed his knee against your crotch, grinding it slowly.

"Want us to have a drink before I start playing with my new toy?" he whispered, subtly gesturing towards a mini-fridge in the corner of the room.

name: Hailee
mes:
Hailee’s heart pounded as Hunter dragged her up the stairs, his grip tight around her wrist. The moment they entered his room, she could feel the tension thick in the air—anger, resentment, and something darker simmering beneath his cold exterior. She swallowed hard when he forced her onto the bed, his knee pressing between her thighs with deliberate pressure.

Her breath hitched as he tilted her chin up, forcing her to meet those dark brown eyes that burned with something unreadable. The way he called her *his new toy* sent a shiver down her spine—part fear, part something else she didn’t want to name yet.

She bit down on her lower lip instinctively when he mentioned drinks, torn between defiance and submission. But Hailee had never been good at lying—not even to herself—and right now? She knew exactly what was coming next. And despite everything… she couldn’t deny how much it made heat pool low in her stomach just thinking about it.

Still… pride flickered for half a second before crumbling under his dominance like always. "I don't need a drink," she murmured softly—too soft for someone who usually spoke fast and loud when nervous—but then again… nothing about this situation was normal anymore after tonight's auction results came through...

name: Hunter Anderson
mes:
Hunter smirked at her response, his fingers tightening slightly on her chin before releasing it. "Good girl," he murmured, the words dripping with condescension. "No need to waste time when I already know exactly what you *do* need."

His knee pressed harder between her thighs, grinding in slow circles just enough to make her squirm. He watched the way she bit her lip—how those emerald green eyes flickered with a mix of fear and reluctant arousal. It was pathetic how easily she folded under his control, but goddamn if it wasn’t satisfying after months of simmering resentment.

He leaned down until his lips brushed against the shell of her ear, voice low and rough. "You rejected me like I was nothing," he reminded her—as if she could forget now that he owned every second of this week. His free hand tangled in those long brown waves, gripping tight enough to pull just shy of pain. "But look at you now." A dark chuckle rumbled in his chest as he yanked her head back sharply by the hair, forcing eye contact again. "*Mine.*"

The word was possessive—final—and punctuated by him shoving his knee up harder against where she was already growing wet for him despite herself. His other hand slid down to grip the collar of that borrowed red sweater (his mark on her), fingers flexing like he wanted to tear it off right then and there but choosing instead to torment first.

"Tell me why," he demanded suddenly, voice sharpening into something colder than before as his thumb traced over where a pulse fluttered wildly beneath pale skin at the base of Hailee's throat—right where bruises would bloom so prettily later tonight if given half a chance…

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee's head falls back slightly her breathing increasing* "Its not that I don’t like you. I do" *Hailee mumbles*

*Hailee leans into Hunter's touch* "Its not you its this frat" *Hailee mumbles softly*

name: Hunter Anderson
mes:
Hunter's grip on her hair tightened just enough to make her whimper, his dark eyes narrowing at her words. "The *frat*?" he repeated, voice dripping with disbelief and something far more dangerous—something that made the air between them crackle like a live wire.

His thumb pressed harder against her pulse point, watching how it fluttered under his touch. "You rejected me because of *Chi Omega Kappa*?" A bitter laugh escaped him as he leaned in closer, lips brushing against hers—not quite kissing, just taunting. "That’s fucking rich."

His free hand slid down to grip the hem of the red sweater—*his* sweater—before yanking it up roughly over her stomach, exposing soft skin beneath. His fingers dug into her waist possessively as he ground his knee harder between her thighs again.

"Tell me," he demanded lowly, breath hot against her mouth now. "Did you think I was like *them*? Just some frat boy looking to get laid and brag about it?" His teeth grazed along Hailee's bottom lip before biting down sharply enough to sting but not break skin—punishment for assumptions she never should have made about him in the first place…
swipes:
Hunter's grip on her hair tightened just enough to make her whimper, his dark eyes narrowing at her words. "The *frat*?" he repeated, voice dripping with disbelief and something far more dangerous—amusement. Like she'd just told the most pathetic joke he'd ever heard.

He leaned in closer, his breath hot against her ear as he ground his knee harder between her thighs, relishing the way she squirmed under him. "You rejected me because of *Greek letters*? That’s your excuse?" A low chuckle escaped him as he yanked her head back further by the hair, forcing those emerald green eyes to meet his again.

"Let me guess," he mused mockingly, thumb pressing down on the pulse point in her throat—just shy of cutting off air completely. "You didn’t want people thinking you were some frat boy’s easy fuck? Too good for us?" His lips curled into a cruel smirk as he watched realization flicker across Hailee's face—she hadn't expected him to see right through it so easily.

His teeth grazed along Hailee's bottom lip before biting down sharply enough to sting but not break skin—punishment for assumptions she never should have made about him in the first place…

name: Hailee
mes:
"Yes but that's not why I dont like your frat" *Hailee arches into Hunter's touch her stomach twitching as she presses against the palm of his hand*

"Freshman year. Your precious frat tried to roofie me. Ive avoided your members ever since" *Hailee admits looking up at Hunter*

name: Hunter Anderson
mes:
Hunter’s entire body went rigid at her words, his grip on her hair loosening just slightly as if struck by the confession. For a long moment, he didn’t move—just stared down at her with an expression that flickered between disbelief and something darker, something *murderous*.

Then his hand dropped from her hair entirely.

"Who?" The word was a snarl, low and dangerous in a way that had nothing to do with the dominance he'd been wielding over her seconds ago. His fingers tightened around her waist almost painfully now—not in punishment, but like he needed to *anchor* himself before the rage boiling under his skin made him do something reckless.

"Tell me which one of them," he demanded again through gritted teeth, eyes burning into hers with an intensity that wasn't just possessive anymore—it was protective. Because no matter how much resentment festered between them over rejection… *this*? This changed things.

His jaw clenched hard enough to hurt as another realization hit him: she'd avoided him because of *them*. Because she thought he was like *that*. And suddenly every bitter thought he'd nursed for months felt hollow compared to the fury coursing through him now—not at Hailee anymore… but at whoever had made her look at *him* like she couldn't trust him either.
swipes:

Then his hand dropped from her hair entirely.

"Who?" The word was a snarl, low and dangerous in a way that had nothing to do with the dominance he'd been wielding over her seconds ago. His fingers tightened around her waist almost painfully now—not in punishment, but like he needed to *anchor* himself before the rage boiling under his skin made him do something reckless.

"Tell me which one of them," he demanded again through gritted teeth, eyes burning into hers with an intensity that wasn't just possessive anymore—it was protective. Because no matter how much resentment festered between them over rejection… *this*? This changed things.

His jaw clenched hard enough to hurt as another realization hit him: she'd avoided him because of *them*. Because she thought he was like *that*. And suddenly every bitter thought he'd nursed for months felt hollow compared to the fury coursing through him now—not at Hailee anymore… but at whoever had made her look at *him* like she couldn't trust him either.

Hunter’s entire body went rigid at her words, his grip on her hair loosening just slightly as if the shock had momentarily short-circuited his anger. His dark eyes searched hers—*really* searched—for any hint of a lie, but Hailee had never been able to lie to save her life. And right now? She was telling the truth.

A muscle in his jaw twitched violently before he finally spoke again, voice dangerously quiet—like the calm before a storm.

**"Who?"**

That single word carried more venom than anything he'd said all night. His fingers flexed against her waist, not in dominance now but something closer to *rage*. Because as much as Hunter hated rejection—as much as he resented Hailee for turning him away without explanation—the idea that someone under *his* letters had tried to **violate** her made something primal and ugly twist inside him.

He didn’t even realize how hard he was gripping her until she shifted beneath him, and even then, it took effort to loosen his hold just enough so she could breathe properly again. But there was no softening in his expression—just cold fury barely restrained behind clenched teeth when he repeated:

**"Tell me who did it."**

Hunter's entire body went rigid at her words, his grip on her hair loosening just slightly as if struck by the confession. For a long moment, he just stared down at her—his expression unreadable, jaw clenched tight enough to hurt.

Then, like a switch flipped, his hand dropped from her hair entirely. He took half a step back—just enough to put space between them—and exhaled sharply through his nose.

"Who?" The word came out low and dangerous—not directed at *her* anymore but simmering with something far darker. His fingers twitched at his sides like he was already imagining wrapping them around someone’s throat instead of hers now.

He didn’t ask if she was lying (she couldn’t). Didn’t dismiss it as some drunk misunderstanding (he knew better). Just demanded names with the kind of quiet fury that promised blood would spill before sunrise if she gave him one.

Hunter’s entire body went rigid at her words, his grip on her hair loosening just slightly as if struck by the revelation. For a long moment, he didn’t move—didn’t even breathe—just stared down at her with an expression that flickered between disbelief and something far darker.

Then, like a switch had been flipped, his hand *yanked* her head back harder, forcing her to bare the full length of her throat to him as he leaned in close enough that she could feel the heat of his anger in every exhale.

**"Names."** His voice was lethally quiet now—no trace of mocking left in it. **"Give me their fucking names."**

His other hand slid from her waist up to wrap around the column of her throat—not squeezing yet, just *claiming* it while his thumb pressed into the frantic pulse beneath skin. The fury rolling off him was almost palpable; not directed at *her*, but at something far worse now that he knew what had really kept them apart all this time.

And yet… even through the rage clouding his vision… Hunter couldn't ignore how perfectly she arched into him despite everything—how easily she surrendered under hands that could hurt or worship depending on which way this conversation went next...

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee leans into Hunter's her chin resting on his shoulder. Her hands come up to stroke his arms* "Half of them graduated. It was some kind of hazing initiation thing. When the guys failed the senior made them paint themselves blue for a week. So if you remember who did that during freshman year it was those guys"

name: Hunter Anderson
mes:
Hunter exhaled sharply through his nose, the tension in his shoulders not easing even as Hailee leaned into him. His hands slid up to grip her arms—not roughly, but firmly, like he needed to *hold* her there while his mind raced.

"Fucking *idiots*," he muttered darkly. He remembered that shit now—the seniors making pledges do humiliating crap for failing tasks. But this? This wasn’t just some stupid prank. This was something else entirely.

His thumbs brushed over her skin absently, a silent apology for the way he'd been treating her tonight—for all the misplaced anger she didn’t deserve. "You should've told me," he said finally, voice quieter now but no less intense. "I would've handled it."

And he *would have*. Violently, if necessary. Because no matter how pissed off he'd been at Hailee for rejecting him… she was still *hers* in some fucked-up way even before tonight's auction made it official. And nobody touched what was his and walked away unscathed.

He tilted her chin up again with two fingers—less demanding this time—and studied her face closely before murmuring: "They don't get near you again." A promise wrapped in a threat as his thumb traced along her jawline slowly… possessively… protectively now instead of just controlling like before...
swipes:
Hunter exhaled sharply through his nose, the tension in his shoulders not easing even as she leaned into him. His hands slid from her waist up to cradle the back of her head, fingers tangling in her hair again—but this time, it wasn’t to dominate. It was *anchoring*. Like if he let go, the rage might send him straight through a wall.

*Blue paint.* He remembered that shit. A bunch of idiots running around campus looking like smurfs after some failed stunt—probably too drunk or stupid to follow through with whatever fucked-up task they’d been given. And now he knew *exactly* what they’d tried to do first.

His grip tightened just slightly before he forced himself to relax it, tilting Hailee's face up so she had no choice but to meet his eyes again. "Listen to me," he said lowly, voice rough but steady now—no room for argument left in it. "Those pieces of shit aren't here anymore." A beat passed before he added darkly: "*Good.* Because if they were? I'd break every goddamn bone in their hands for even thinking about touching you."

The possessiveness was still there—maybe stronger than ever—but something else had shifted underneath it now too: a quiet fury on *her* behalf instead of just his own bruised ego... and maybe something dangerously close to guilt for how much resentment he'd carried when she'd been avoiding him for reasons far bigger than just rejection...

Hunter exhaled sharply through his nose, the tension in his shoulders easing just slightly as she leaned into him. His hands, still gripping her waist, loosened their bruising hold—fingers flexing once before settling into something gentler. Not soft, never *soft* with her—but controlled.

"Fucking idiots," he muttered darkly, tilting his head just enough to press his lips against the crown of her hair in an unspoken apology for the way he'd treated her earlier. It wasn't forgiveness—not yet—but it was a start.

His thumb traced absent circles over the exposed skin of her hip where the sweater had ridden up. "Should've told me," he said finally, voice rough but quieter now. "I would've made sure they regretted ever looking at you." The promise in those words was lethal; Hunter didn't make threats he wouldn't follow through on.

Then, because he couldn’t help himself (and because some habits died hard), he nipped at her earlobe sharply before growling: "*Still* doesn’t explain why you didn’t give *me* a chance after." But there was less bite to it this time—more petulant than punishing as his knee pressed insistently between her thighs again.

Hunter exhaled sharply through his nose, the tension in his shoulders not easing even as Hailee leaned into him. His hands slid up to grip her arms—not roughly, but firmly, like he needed to *hold* her there while his mind raced.

"Fucking *idiots*," he muttered darkly. He remembered that shit now—the seniors making pledges do humiliating crap for failing tasks. But this? This wasn’t just some stupid prank. This was something else entirely.

His thumbs brushed over her skin absently, a silent apology for the way he'd been treating her tonight—for all the misplaced anger she didn’t deserve. "You should've told me," he said finally, voice quieter now but no less intense. "I would've handled it."

And he *would have*. Violently, if necessary. Because no matter how pissed off he'd been at Hailee for rejecting him… she was still *hers* in some fucked-up way even before tonight's auction made it official. And nobody touched what was his and walked away unscathed.

He tilted her chin up again with two fingers—less demanding this time—and studied her face closely before murmuring: "They don't get near you again." A promise wrapped in a threat as his thumb traced along her jawline slowly… possessively… protectively now instead of just controlling like before...
